description: Discover the best hotels in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Find exclusive deals and luxury accommodations.

hotels.title: Serene Cambodia Suite Escape Overlooking Mekong River
hotels.description: Wake to stunning Mekong River views from The Balé Phnom Penh by LifestyleRetreats, a gorgeous all-suite retreat in Cambodia’s capital, awarded the 2021 Tripadvisor Travellers Choice award. Take in breathtaking views from the 30-metre swimming pool alongside the river and arrive in style as you walk across a pink sandstone walkway across a black-bottomed infinity pond into this serene haven. Spend a night dining at the resort’s Theato restaurant, where you're spoilt for choice with delicious local dishes like Mekong River lobster and rice noodles, rice porridge, and water buffalo skewers. Back in your private, high-end suite - one of just 18 - relax in the outdoor living space, soak in the bathtub and then lay your head on a sumptuous, floating king bed. The Balé Phnom Penh by LifestyleRetreats is set in a peaceful pocket of Phnom Penh, about a thirty-minute drive to some of the city’s major sites including the Royal Palace and the Silver Pagoda.

hotels.title: Stylish Phnom Penh City Break near Royal Palace of Cambodia
hotels.description: Discover everything that makes Cambodia’s capital so phenomenal with a stay at Oakwood Premier Phnom Penh. Conveniently located in the vibrant business centre - just minutes from the dazzling spires of the Royal Palace of Cambodia - it’s the perfect base to experience Phnom Penh’s extraordinary collection of galleries, museums and historic buildings. Laze by the hotel’s shimmering pool or explore the city’s dazzling treasures, including the iconic Psar Thmei central market.

hotels.vendor_name: TRIBE Phnom Penh Post Office Square
hotels.title: Contemporary Cambodia Stay in Phnom Penh with Onsite Dining & Rooftop Pool
hotels.description: This chic hotel offers a unique blend of French heritage and traditional Khmer architecture, with a prime location along the Mekong River. Stay energised with 24/7 grab-and-go delights at TRIBE Express, take some time to unwind by the rooftop pool or hit the gym to keep up with your routine. Beyond the hotel, explore cultural gems like the Grand Royal Palace and Wat Phnom temple, or head to the nearby Central Market, teeming with artisanal goodies and souvenirs. Lined with charming cafes and restaurants, the picturesque Sisowath Quay invites leisurely strolls.

hotels.title: Sophisticated Escape in Central Phnom Penh with Two Outdoor Pools & Spa
hotels.description: Treasure this serene sanctuary in the heart of Phnom Penh, where timeless Khmer tradition harmonises with refined French colonial style. Ideally located near the riverfront and just steps from the Royal Palace, Independence Monument and National Museum, this hotel offers a luxurious escape in the city’s vibrant cultural core. Relish the flavours of Italy at Do Forni, delight in refined Japanese cuisine at Hachi or indulge in global gastronomy at La Coupole, featuring live cooking stations and fresh seafood. Relax beneath swaying palms by one of two outdoor pools, or retreat to Sofitel Spa for a rejuvenating etreatment. Whether sipping a cocktail at Le Bar or exploring Phnom Penh’s rich heritage, every moment is infused with elegance and ease.

hotels.title: Central Phnom Penh Escape near the Mekong River with Outdoor Pool, Restaurant & Two Bars
hotels.description: Feel the buzz of Phnom Penh from this sleek city stay, ideally positioned in the bustling Boeung Keng Kang district. This contemporary retreat offers a serene sanctuary amid the city's dynamic pulse, with a sparkling outdoor pool and tranquil day spa to help you unwind. When hunger strikes, head to the hotel's European restaurant, where you can savour a fusion of Basque, French and Spanish flavours. Venture out to explore the city's rich history and culture, with the Royal Palace and the iconic Independence Monument just a short tuk-tuk ride away. For shopping enthusiasts, the Central Market and Aeon Mall offer a plethora of boutiques and eateries. In the late afternoon, take a stroll along the Mekong River, as the sunset illuminates Asia's most iconic waterway.
